alert.note: Alert for Eddy; Lea (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued September 11 at 7:11PM MDT until September 11 at 8:15PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Eddy County in southeastern New Mexico... Southern Lea County in southeastern New Mexico... Northwestern Reeves County in southwestern Texas... Northwestern Winkler County in western Texas... Northeastern Culberson County in southwestern Texas... Northern Loving County in western Texas... * Until 915 PM CDT/815 PM MDT/. * At 810 PM CDT/710 PM MDT/, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Monument to 10 miles northeast of Loving to 8 miles north of Whites City, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail, as well as blowing dust reducing visibility. SOURCE...ASOS measured 66 mph wind gusts in Carlsbad. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Carlsbad, Eunice, Jal, Loving, Monument, Eunice Airport, Malaga, Jal Airport, Red Bluff Reservoir, Orla, Whites City, Carlsbad Caverns National Park, Otis, Cavern City Air Terminal, Bennett, Oil Center, and Red Bluff. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail, damaging wind, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
